column2: What features are missing from your sources of information that you would like to see included?

column1: a lot of people are unaware of the extra $50 app fee(can be waved with Mass Health). They also don't realize that medical marijuana isn't taxed.
A more accurate understanding of the trace cannabinoids in the products available.
a step by step learning process for beginners that want relief without a high
Ability to get products from other states
Absolute levels and ratios of cbd, thc, cbdn, thca, cbda, terpenes etc
Accurate product testing, plant genetics/lineage/strain history
Actual rigorous medical research on benefits and harm of marijuana
Although most sites have a recommended dose for an ailment I would like to see more sites tell people to start with a low dose, 1mg. and slowly go up as symptoms inprove.
Better care for disabled and veterans who are low income
Better inventory of what local dispensary has
Better reporting of cannabinoids and terpenes levels. Date of harvest and where grown
Charts showing mg to dose equivalents
Details on how to identify strains
dont have good sources.  will try the ones you mentioned apps/websites
Dosage, testing information, safety details, loyalty, strain and product tracking/dosage logging.
dosing and best ways to get the most benefit
Each site has plus and minus.  Multiple sources are required to get a complete picture
Ease of finding strains. More medical info.
easier correlation between dispensary menu and product reviews
Easier navigation of site on mobile
Fact based truth in the medical community
First time I have heard about this.
Growth stages and more indepth strain specific growing journals for all strains
hard to find the map of legal states
Heavy Metal/Pesticide and Terpine lab tests from certified labs
home processing of flower to topicals
How exactly to use, as well as what to do if something unplanned for happens (like a coughing fit), for us neophytes!
how it affects large groups of people
How to measure THC and CBD
How to save the most money
hyperlinks to government laws on cannabis, views of lawmakers
I'd like a helpful newsletter from BASK.
I'd like to be able to research the local brands.
I'm satisfied with the amount of features present
I am a caregiver and in 98 I did 1 yr in jail n now want to get in the cannabis biz but would need help
I am happy with the sources info
I can not think of anything
I don't feel that Recreational shops are keen on folks who do not want to be high. Most seniors feel intimidated to enter pot shops, because it is over whelming...among other things.
I get all the info that I ask for. If my dispensary agent does not know, he will find someone who does.

I have been an RN for 35 years. I hated pot. Tried it in High School. I was extremely reluctant to try it.  I had tried multiple pain meds including narcotics but they make me sick. I became so severely depressed that I had to be hospitalized. Marijuana has not only helped my pain,it has greatly improved my mood,my activity tolerance,and my sleep.
I never heard of any of the above until taking this survey!
I pretty much always find the information I am looking for...
I wish the online strain info had more feedback from medical users in addition to recreational users

I would like more specific medical info as related to cannabinoids and terpene profiles.  I would also like my Licences Providers (Canada) to be more knowledgeable in this area.  I have received better advice from non-Licensed dispensaries.
If any chemicals have been used to grow product
If edibles are available in a limited stock (i.e., the dispensary does not make their own edible products and must rely on another dispensary or distributor for products.
Incoming stains? Maybe something to look forward to.
Info not always applicable to state that I live in

ingredients in everything! including papers on pre-rolls, which can have corn and gluten in them. Severe food allergies. Also, list pesticide and chemicals used on the plants. The use of non organic practices must be transparent, and there is also a concern with allergies to these chemicals.
Insa needs to put more info on menus
Less descriptive re the high, more medical info
less emphasis on strain name and more emphasis and transparency re terpene profile
Local caregivers ancillary businesses social clubs community host agreements
Local grower information to keep up with new strains.
Location of strain im looking for
Medical strain names differ from common names
More ailments listed to pair with a strain.
More descriptions of medical benefits and side effects
More detailed info for new consumers
More direct brand patients education, facility tours and manufacturing processes, more education from testing labs
More explanation about the product. Web pages are very vague
More fear nformation on benefits of cannabis
More in depth articles on deficiencies
More info on tinctures and edible use
more info on what strains work best for different ailments..and more info of you are sober
More information about nerve pain and what to use. So confusing.
More information on supporting cannabinoids and terpenes. Most seem to focus on THC content, and according to a recent study THC (like opiates) only distracts you from pain.
More information on what works best for specific medical issues/diagnosis from survey of other patients

more lab reports and analysis of cannabinoid profiles in every strain, the reliability of strains from state-to-state, some standardization of cannabinoid profiles and effects for treating various conditions
More medical info. Like the basic fact that CBD can interact with other drugs and meds. And how chemo patients have got to check with someone they know knows!
More researched data on contraindications with other prescribed drugs and proven effectiveness with specific conditions such as IBS, arthritis, etc.
more specific dosing , more specific information for various illnessess
more strain specific indications (ie, Best Anxiety strains, etc)

Needs better labeling of dosage amount / mg and in mls. I began with a micro dose and used the dropper as a measure! My dose was much lower good thing I’m a retired nurse because calculations were need and the worker didn’t have any knowledge of how much for me. He stated it was a 750mg 30ml bottle and I the consumer had to figure it ou. My dose was minuscule a calibrated syringe ie for diabetics would have been helpful
None really; Leafly reviews are pretty thorough
None that I can think of.
None.  I rely on the advice of BASK Fairhaven.
Not 100% sure on that one at the moment
Not all show the percentages of THC or CBD and would like to see more percentage wheels that show more of the cannabinoids in the strain by percent
nothing i can think of right now
Nothing, I’m able find what I’m searching for
online ordering, but that's long to come
pesticides and fertilizers used on crop
Price comparison of area distributers, or Specials comparison in live time
Purchase locations near me- none listed for my area.
Quick reference print out of strains and properties
QUITE SATISFIED AS i DO RESEARCH AND COMPARE NOTES
Recycling programs for small plastic containers. Not just bags. More distillate refills options for carts.
Regional information that is consistent.  What happens in CA isn't the same as CO, or MA.
Reliable sources and proven testing on products
Sheets of what it does and how much it is. And a check list for what you need it for and what would be best for you
some strains my dispensary have has no info in leafly
sometimes I go to Leafly & my strain is not shown, but I'll google it & one of the links will be Leafly!
specific dosing case histories & nurse/MD recommendations
Step by step instructions for maximizing medicinal use
Strain name on medical products frim dispensary
They claim that every single strain is the BEST
What exactly works for certain chronic pain and exact doses.
What is available in my town
What strains are best for health reason your using it for.   The place I go suggest stuff, but it has been a trial and error .
what the rso is made with
when I'm reading and looking at these resources at the time I go "these should have" and now when I'm asked I can't think of them
Where I can get certain products and cost
Where to get items not available locally to me
Which products effectively treat my medical issues
